# PlainSight Chrome Extension v1.0.1

PlainSight is a Chrome extension designed to allow users to secretly communicate in plain sight. Messages are encrypted and stored within a custom tag as hex. These messages can be placed anywhere on the web and only those who have the extension and the same key have the ability to read them. If other users are using a different key, no error will be thrown but the message will be garbled.

## How to Use:

When PlainSight is first installed, it only has access to the active tab when the user invokes the extension via the badge icon in the top right corner of the browser (click the puzzle piece icon if you don't see it) or via the context menu (right click anywhere on the page). This limits the functionality and it is highly recommended that users elevate the extension's permissions. Without elevated permissions, automatic page decryption is not possible.

All of the configuration and message encryption of PlainSight is handled through the extension popup which can be accessed by clicking the badge icon mentioned above. It is recommended that the user pin the badge icon via the "Extensions" popup (puzzle piece icon) for easy access. At the very top of the PlainSight popup is the current version of the extension and an option to elevate permissions. As previously mentioned, it is highly recommended that users elevate the extension's permissions to access all pages, although this is not a requirement. Beneath the extension version information is the "Active Key" input box. This is the key used to encrypt and decrypt messages and can be changed at any time.

If permissions have been elevated, the "Automatically decrypt pages" checkbox will be available. Checking this box will cause the extension to automatically scan for and decrypt encrypted messages on any page the user visits when the page is first loaded and whenever the page is updated. If this box is not checked, the user will need to manually perform scans by either opening the popup and clicking the "Decrypt Page" button or by right clicking on the page and selecting "Decrypt page" under PlainSight. Messages in the active tab that have already been decrypted will be reprocessed in real-time if the user updates the active key. If automatic page decryption is disabled, the user also has the option to revert decrypted messages to their original encrypted form. To continue reading, set your active key to "tutorial" without quotations (case-sensitive) and decrypt this page.
